Package com.audriuskumpis.library.service

Class PublicationFactory

java.lang.Object
com.audriuskumpis.library.service.PublicationFactory
public class PublicationFactory
extends java.lang.Object
Factory class to create types of publications. This class implements two ways of creatig publications: 1. With static factory method PublicationFactory.create() 2. Using build() and setter methods.
See Also:
PublicationTypes

    This method build a publication that was created using setValues methods.
    static Publication create​(PublicationTypes publicationType, java.lang.String title, Author author, int pages, int isbn, int releaseYear)
    Creates a publication object by given parameters Example: library.addPublication(PublicationFactory.create(PublicationTypes.TEXTBOOK, "A title", new Author("Name", "Surname"), 97, 123456, 2020));

    • build

      public Publication build()
      This method build a publication that was created using setValues methods.
      Returns:
      a publication with set methods.

    • create

      public static Publication create​(PublicationTypes publicationType, java.lang.String title, Author author, int pages, int isbn, int releaseYear)
      Creates a publication object by given parameters Example: library.addPublication(PublicationFactory.create(PublicationTypes.TEXTBOOK, "A title", new Author("Name", "Surname"), 97, 123456, 2020));
      Parameters:
      publicationType - enum of publication types
      title - of the book
      author - of the book
      pages - of book
      isbn - of book
      releaseYear - of book
      Returns:
      a new instance of publication created. Null if something went wrong
